meanings.definition: Next in time or order; nearest.
meanings.sent1: The proximo meeting is scheduled for tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: The proximo train arrives at 3 PM.
meanings.sent3: I always forget my keys in the proximo room.
meanings.sent4: The proximo deadline is looming over us.
meanings.sent5: The proximo bus is always crowded during rush hour.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the following month.
meanings.sent1: She marked the proximo date on her calendar.
meanings.sent2: The proximo rent payment is due on the first.
meanings.sent3: The proximo party is going to be a blast.
meanings.sent4: His proximo paycheck will be larger due to overtime.
meanings.sent5: The proximo holiday falls on a weekend this year.

meanings.sent1: We are planning a trip for the proximo.
meanings.sent2: The proximo is usually busier with work deadlines.
meanings.sent3: I can't wait for the proximo to start, so I can relax.
meanings.sent4: The proximo is when the new movie releases come out.
meanings.sent5: The proximo always brings new opportunities and challenges.
